channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Red Path, 17th August
item.description:
At the Eastway end… very overgrown causing cyclist to swerve into the pedestrian lane. Please cut back urgently before September and school children / prams start using the path again.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edmeston Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Large amount of dog or maybe human waste on residential street, 17th August
item.description:
Large amount of dog or maybe human waste by a lamppost on Merrow Street. Large amount of footfall passing by could spread this further. Also young kids including my own are playing in the street in the holidays which means this is dangerous for them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrow Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Overhanging Ivy - Red Path, 17th August
item.description:

item.title: The “Hackney city council” bins overflowing, 17th August
item.description:

item.description:
This motorbike has been on the public path for over 3 years. It is chained to the fence. It was dumped along with another int he property of 134 by a resident in the HMO. The resident no longer lives there. The bike will not be removed

item.title: Blocked drains causing sickening smell outside my house., 17th August
item.description:
These drains have been blocked for a while. Several of them have even been highlighted with blue spray paint as blocked. The one in the picture with the cones is giving off a sickening smell making me and my family feel ill as it’s lingering around our house. Smell has been present since 13th August. This is the drain outside 65 Normandy way Erith da8 3px

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colyers Lane, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains bad odour almost gas like smell, 17th August
item.description:
For the last 3 days it’s smelt really bad seems to be getting worse making me feel sick every time I leave my house
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Normandy Way, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked that do not have bays and do not live here, 17th August
item.description:
There are a number of cars that keep parking in the car park at Braganza Street SE17 3RD. These cars are not tenants and do not occupy the bays. They are people that work in the area or people that live on other streets that obviously do not want to pay the fee for on street parking. Its becoming a huge problem as there are so many cars that are not doing this it blocks he tenants cars that are parked in the bays ( that live there) from getting out. One resident was unable to use there care for 4 days as someone had parked there car in front of theirs, blocking them in. They obviously went away because the car was not moved until the following week. There are signs also up that clearly state no parking but clearly this is not being acknowledged. This is been going on for over a year and since new properties have been erected leaving left parking space for certain businesses that staff obviously used to park. Also these cars have caused damage to other cars and to the posts marking the bays in the car park

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Braganza Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
